sections.title: Lightweight bases with clinician-guided adjustments
sections.body: We use polished acrylic bases, fit check sprays, and bite balancing to reduce rocking and sore spots. If you need more grip, we talk through soft liners, careful adhesive use, or implant stabilisation when appropriate.

faqs.question: How long do acrylic dentures last?
faqs.answer: With good care they can last several years, but relines or replacements may be needed as gums reshape or if teeth wear. We outline expected review points.

faqs.question: Will they feel bulky?
faqs.answer: Acrylic bases are slightly thicker than chrome. We slim areas where safe and stage try-ins to balance strength with comfort.

faqs.question: Can they break?
faqs.answer: Like any acrylic, drops or grinding can cause fractures. We cover how to protect them and what repairs or remakes might involve.

faqs.question: Do I need adhesive?
faqs.answer: Some patients use a small amount for reassurance, especially for lower dentures. We prioritise fit first and discuss implant support if you want more stability.
